title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 3 February 2017 - BBC News
summary: environment agency carries out big operation to clear shropshire pool of unwanted invaders .
mp warns hospital restructuring money could be at risk .
german bomber delivered to raf museum cosford .

documents.title: wellington businessman upset by far-right claims
text: a director of a computer and mobile-phone repair shop in wellington says claims , made about it by the right-wing group , britain first , are `` shameful '' and `` laughable '' .
the group 's leader paul golding said a small islamic symbol fixed to the shop-front showed that it was run by extremists .
the symbol on the sign is the seal of the prophet muhammed which also appears on the flag of islamic state , but wehid iqbal said he 'd been using the emblem long before is appeared .
mr iqbal , who took part in an aid mission to turkey last year , said the claims had put his staff in danger , but that he had received many messages of support .
`` the seal of the prophet is over 1400 years old .
i have used it on my numerous businesses for over 13 years and way before the advent of isis .
for him to come outside the shop to claim my retail outlet is a hotbed of islamic extremism and a recruitment base for isis is totally absurd and laughable .
his actions mean that many people who have no interest in actually evaluating what he says and taking it as true has put my staff and business in danger . ''

documents.title: review 'could create orthopaedic centre '
text: review 'could create orthopaedic centre '

documents.title: shrewsbury town 2-1 bury
text: shrewsbury town 2-1 bury

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: weather : rain tonight , but a drier weekend ahead
text: we 're forecast a wet end to the day , but it should be a lot drier over the weekend .
temperatures will remain low though , reaching a maximum of around 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: football : shrewsbury defender looks ahead to big month
text: shrewsbury town have had some encouraging results recently and buoyed by eight new signings , they are starting to climb out of the league one relegation zone .
defender matt sadler sees february as a crucial month in their battle to beat the drop , starting with bury tomorrow .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: plans for burial mound go on display this weekend
text: plans to create a modern version of a long barrow burial mound are going on display to the public on sunday .
a company which has built similar mounds , to store ashes , is applying to built it in the grounds of soulton hall , near wem .
the open day , which will run between 14:00 and 17:00 will be attended by two of the companies directors and a professor from cambridge university .

documents.title: ludlow nut company lands japanese contract
text: muesli made in ludlow is being eaten from breakfast tables in japan .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: increase in child on child sex offences
text: increase in child on child sex offences

documents.title: rise in child-on-child sex offences : young people 'more confident to go to police '
text: a doubling in the number of recorded sex offences involving children on other children is a `` cause for concern '' say west mercia police , but also shows `` young people and the wider communities are more confident about reporting to police '' .
figures obtained by the children 's charity barnardo 's show the number of such offences rose by 128 % in three years .
west mercia police say the increase in the use of social media , both by victims and those carrying out sex crimes , has also contributed to the rise .
we will work hard to prosecute those responsible whilst also taking into account the wishes of the victim .
any sexual offences reported to the police receive a high priority , especially those involving children . ''

documents.title: headlines : shopkeeper upset by claims ; operation to clear pool of invaders ; bomber arrives at cosford
text: our headlines this evening :
- wellington businessman upset by far-right claims about his shop
- big operation to clear unwanted topmouth gudgeon from shropshire pool
- german bomber arrives at cosford raf museum
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: museum 's latest acquisition excites head of collections
text: the latest arrival at the raf cosford museum has been described by the head of collections there as `` one of the most versatile military aircraft of all time '' .
the junkers ju88 was captured in 1943 by two spitfires and has been at the raf london museum since 1978 .

five other aircraft have also been delivered by road to the raf cosford museum in recent months - a messerschmitt bf109g-2 a de havilliand tiger moth ii a wolverhampton-built boulton paul defiant m1 a gloster gladiator 1 and a westland lysander iii .
this particular example , the last surviving night fighter variant , has a truly fascinating story to tell .
it will be displayed alongside other significant german aircraft of the period and will enhance the museum 's ability to tell the wider story of raf operations during the second world war . ''

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers want to keep the games coming
text: the games have been coming thick and fast for the telford tigers recently , who are in the middle of a spell of seven games in two weeks .
head coach tom watkins thinks it suits his side to be playing games , rather than training and they have been able to build up an 11-point cushion at the top of the english premier league .
this weekend they face two other teams in good form , basingstoke and peterborough .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: refugees in shropshire face many challenges - imam
text: the imam in craven arms says syrian refugees who have moved to shropshire face a range of challenges .
there are now syrian refugees in oswestry , wem , shrewsbury and much wenlock .
imam sohayb peerbhai , says families are contending with culture shock , the language barrier , and emotional turmoil .
it 's the trauma of leaving family behind and knowing they are actually suffering because of what is going on there and they are safe here .
it 's this kind of mental pressures that they have . ''
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: topmouth gudgeon operation took months to plan
text: the environment agency says it took months to plan an operation to clear a shropshire pool of topmouth gudgeon - an invasive species from asia .
it said it then took several weeks to remove the native fish and check them four times , before treating the pool with a poison called rotenone which killed tens of thousands of topmouth gudgeon .
the operation is now complete .

documents.title: football : the new saints host cardiff mu
text: following their long winning run the new saints sit 21 points clear at the top of the welsh premier league , but face a tricky cardiff metropolitan university side at park hall tomorrow .
the two sides have met twice already this season and on both occasions tns had to come from behind to win .
meanwhile , the other teams in the top six all play each other , so tns could extend their lead .

documents.title: german bomber arrives at cosford raf museum
text: another aircraft has been delivered to the raf museum at cosford .
the gernan junkers ju88 arrived on the back of a lorry from its sister museum in london and will be going on display soon .
it 's the sixth and final aeroplane to make the switch , as part of a reorganisation of the two museums .

documents.title: body found in river is man missing from shropshire
text: the body found yesterday in the river severn near worcester is that of a missing man from shropshire , police say .
west mercia police say david smith was reported missing from bridgnorth on sunday , 27 november - his next of kin have been informed .
his body found in the river severn at holt heath near worcester yesterday .
the emergency service began searching after a member of the public reported seeing a body going over the weir at holt fleet (
police are not treating the death as sus

documents.title: headlines : shropshire pool cleared of invaders ; mp 's hospital cash warning ; reported sex offences by children double
text: our headlines this afternoon include :
- environment agency carries out big operation to clear shropshire pool of unwanted invaders
- mp warns hospital restructuring money could be lost unless agreement is reached
- recorded sex offences by children double in west mercia area
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : yates excited at shrewsbury town opportunity
text: shrewsbury town 's last signing before the january transfer window was 19-year-old ryan yates from nottingham forest .
he described the atmosphere within the new-look squad as `` electric '' and is excited to get the opportunity to play .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: severn swimmer completes sri lankan challenge
text: an adventurer who swam through shropshire and along the length of the river severn last year has now successfully paddle boarded down sri lanka 's longest river .
kev brady set off before christmas and paddle-boarded the whole of the mahaweli river , encountering elephants , bears and crocodiles along the way .
he 's now making his way around the entire island .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: call for urgent action at telford junction 'before someone is killed '
text: urgent action is needed before someone is killed at a problem road junction , according to residents .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: invasive species removed from pool
text: the environment agency has been working to remove invasive topmouth gudgeon from a pool in shropshire .
the creatures , which are n't native to the uk , breed quickly and are a threat to fish because they compete for food , eat the eggs of other fish and carry a parasite , the agency says .
the location of the pool has n't been given , for business reasons .
our fisheries team have finally completed a difficult project to eradicate non native # topmouthgugeon from a pool in # shropshire # teamea
it 's me !
proof i get out the office occasionally !
fingers crossed on the results .
any likelihood of fry over wintering in the bottom of the water ?
that 's a big fish .
what is it ?
well done chris .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager pleased with additions to squad
text: the shrewsbury town manager has a spring in his step after bringing in eight new players during the january transfer window .
he said this week the squad had had its best training session since he arrived at the club .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : hospital gives pagers to patients waiting for operations
text: patients at the robert jones and agnes hunt hospital at gobowen are being given pagers , so they can be free to leave the surgery waiting room and feel confident of not missing their slot .
the trust says it 's using the pagers in preference to mobile phones because reception is sometimes patchy .

documents.title: children on children sex offences double
text: the number of recorded sex offences committed by children on other children has doubled in the west mercia area , a charity has learned .
a freedom of information request by barnardo 's shows the number of offences rose by 128 % in three years across the whole force area

documents.title: headlines : mp has hospital funding warning ; two groups bid to run library ; patients waiting ops get pagers
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- mp warns hospital restructuring money could be at risk
- two groups bid to run church stretton library
- hospital gives pagers to patients waiting for operations
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: funding for hospital reorganisation in jeopardy , mp says
text: the county 's chances of getting government funding to reconfigure its hospitals are `` being put into jeopardy '' because an agreement ca n't be reached on what to do - according to the mp for shrewsbury .

proposals to downgrade telford 's a & e department and base all emergency care in shrewsbury have faced opposition from politicians in telford and have been put on hold while a review is carried out .

daniel kawczynski warned `` the longer we continue to fight one another in shropshire , the further back in the queue we will come '' and said around £ 300m would be needed to fund the proposed changes .
other parts of the united kingdom are going through the same process and they have got their ducks in a row much quicker than we have done .
they 've come together as counties collectively , cross party , and they are going to the government with their business cases for additional funding . ''

documents.title: weather : heavy rain and blustery winds this afternoon
text: it 's not a good day to be outside , because we are forecast heavy rain and blustery winds this afternoon .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: new town planned on green fields in telford
text: a new town could be built on green fields in telford , with 665 houses , offices , new shops , play areas and new public transport access .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : telford manager pleased with his new goalkeeper
text: the afc telford united manager , rob smith , is pleased with his new goalkeeper and says signing matt urwin was a `` no brainer '' .
urwin was signed from fleetwood town to replace james montgomery , who left to join gateshead .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: road shut for resurfacing work causing 'chaos '
text: a north shropshire road that 's shut during the day for resurfacing work is said to be `` causing chaos '' .
shropshire council says repairing the route between the a49 and the a41 at prees green is `` essential '' and likely to continue for another five weeks .
people who live nearby have described lorries turning around dangerously , and shopkeeper belinda thomas says customers ca n't get to her .
it 's pointless being open , for what i 'm earning .
i get a few customers before they shut the road off at 09:30 and when they reopen it in the afternoon .
but the bit in the middle i get nobody . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a lesson on inhumanity : shropshire pupils shown the horrors of auschwitz
text: pupils from shropshire were shown the horrors of auschwitz during a schools visit to poland this week .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : a & e options explored ; two groups bid for library ; concern about bus subsidy plans
text: our headlines this morning :
- further options explored to keep a & es safe after consultant quits
- two groups bid to run church stretton library
- passenger group complains about bus subsidy plans
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: two groups bid to run church stretton library
text: two groups have come forward to say they 'd like to run church stretton library , shropshire council says .
a previous attempt to move it to a new site was abandoned last year , after a legal challenge by local residents .
it costs shropshire council up to £ 40,000 a year to run the library and the authority wants to hand over control to a charity or community group .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : shrews manager happy with new signings
text: shrewsbury town manager paul hurst says he 's delighted with his new-look squad .
hurst held his first training session yesterday since the transfer window closed on tuesday night and feels the signs look good for a climb up the league one table
that was the best session we 've had since i 've been here and would take some beating to be honest .
in terms of the tempo , the quality , everyone 's attitude , you know for me that 's really set the bar high . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: subsidised bus routes document 'flawed '
text: a document looking at bus routes and which ones shropshire council should subsidise has been described as `` flawed '' by a passenger group .
the council would like commercial companies to run more services , but will also continue to fund priority routes .
the passenger group `` bus users shropshire '' claim the consultation has been used to justify cuts rather than looking at the needs of the rural county .
the council has refused to comment on the outcome of the consultation at this stage .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: call for urgent action at telford junction 'before someone is killed '
text: urgent action is needed before someone is killed at a problem road junction , according to residents .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: options being explored to keep a & e safe
text: the chief executive of shropshire 's two acute hospitals simon wright says further options are being explored to keep accident and emergency services .
it comes as the already stretched service looks set to lose another consultant .
that leaves just four consultants at the two sites , instead of a recommended minimum of 10 .
the trust says the service is fragile and that it ca n't continue to operate in this way .
yesterday , mr wight said a & e services were being kept open on the `` goodwill of staff '' .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: latest : options being explored to keep a & e safe ; council subsidised bus routes document 'flawed '
text: the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- shropshire 's a & e units will be left in a fragile state with the expected loss of another consultant , the hospital trust warns
- document looking at which bus routes shropshire council should subsidise described as `` flawed ''
- closure of a road in prees green for resurfacing is said to be `` causing chaos ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: it 'll be a dry , bright and chilly morning .
however , rain will begin to push in during the afternoon , with some heavy bursts likely at times , and it will become increasingly windy .
top temperatures of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : traffic slow on some routes
text: no accidents to report on the roads this morning .
there 's slow traffic on a5223 whitchurch drive in telford at the ketley brook roundabout in the roadworks area .
for more information visit the bbc travel page .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning - welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: nhs warns of 'incredibly high ' demand on a & e
text: the nhs has issued another request for people with non-critical illnesses or injuries to stay away from the county 's a & e units , and use `` more appropriate alternatives '' .
the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust said 950 people were seen at shropshire 's two a & e units over three days , earlier this week , a level of demand described as `` incredibly high '' .
it says those who do n't need to be there can expect an extremely long wait .

documents.title: weather : strong winds forecast this evening
text: it should remain dry this evening , but we 're forecast strong winds , up to 42mph .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: hospitals say they warned of threat to a & e departments
text: the chief executive of the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust says he warned about the pressure on the county 's two a & e departments last year .
simon wright said that when the future fit review of hospital services began in 2014 , they had seven a & e consultants and following the most recent resignation , they would be down to four .
mr wright also said pressure on accident and emergency had increased , with some patients facing 12-hour waits and that the two departments were being kept open on the `` goodwill of staff '' .

documents.title: latest : a & e under-staffing could mean closures ; health funding questions ; rail strike off
text: our headlines this evening :
- hospitals warn consultant leaving could hit a & e cover
- council wants answers over health funding
- conductors on london midland trains call off their strike
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: update on church stretton power cut
text: western power distribution says it 's restored power to most of the 1,567 homes which lost power earlier today .
we 've got most supplies back on in # shrewsbury # sy4 # tf6 , but are working to restore the remaining properties by approximately 18:00 .
jason

documents.title: consultant shortage could mean a & e closures
text: shropshire 's hospitals say they wo n't be able to staff the county 's a & e units 24 hours a day from june , because another consultant has resigned .
the latest departure , which has been blamed on delays to the future fit review of hospital services , will leave only four consultants employed across telford and shrewsbury .
a board meeting today has heard that unless a replacement can be found , action will have to be taken before the summer to maintain safe services .
that 's likely to include one of the units shutting at times .

documents.title: council wants answers over health funding
text: shropshire council wants to know why the county gets less money from the nhs , compared to the national average .
its health portfolio-holder , karen calder , has written to the junior health minister and ludlow mp , philip dunne , asking for an explanation .
the national average is around £ 2,000 per person a year , but shropshire , including telford and wrekin , gets around £ 200 less .

documents.title: latest : rail strike off ; mother 's online grooming warning ; penny floor an internet hit
text: here are our headlines this afternoon :
- conductors on london midland trains call off their strike
- mother of girl groomed online warns of dangers of giving children computer tablets
- over 100m view telford man 's video of floor he tiled with pennies
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fresh appeal after schoolboy injured in accident
text: police have renewed their appeal for witnesses after a schoolboy suffered serous head injuries in a collision between his bicycle and a car in north shropshire on monday morning .
a white volkswagen was involved in the collision , which happened outside princes electrical on church street in prees .
police say they are particularly keen to trace the driver of a white astra van with black roof bars .
the 15-year-old is being treated at alder hey children 's hospital in liverpool

documents.title: power cut hits homes in church stretton
text: western power distribution say 1,567 homes are affected .
it says initial reports suggest overhead power lines may be down , and the circuit has been `` isolated '' for safety reasons .
we are aware of a # powercut in the # churchstretton area .
we aim to restore all supplies by 13:30 .
steve
what happened ?
we 're not sure what cause is at the moment , but engineers are investigating .
all supplies have been restored .
apologies for this

documents.title: health service concerns taken to the top
text: leaders of shropshire council have taken their concerns about health care in ludlow and south shropshire to whitehall .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: union calls off conductors ' strike vote
text: union calls off conductors ' strike vote

documents.title: latest : mum 's online grooming warning ; poultry expert 's concerns ; penny floor a hit online
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- mother of shropshire girl groomed online warns of dangers of giving children computer tablets
- poultry expert has avian flu warning
- over 100m view shropshire man 's video of a floor tiled with pennies
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: three out of four not getting free flu jab
text: the nhs is encouraging more people to take up the offer of a free flu jab , saying fewer than one in four of those entitled to one in shropshire and staffordshire has taken up the offer .
everyone over the age of 65 is entitled to a free flu vaccination from a doctors surgery or a participating local pharmacy .
people with long-term health problems , pregnant women and carers are also entitled to the free jab .

documents.title: shed fire could be sus
text: the fire service is investigating a shed fire near much wenlock which they say could be `` sus
they received the call to an address in homer at 01:00 today .

documents.title: weather : mild but damp
text: feeling milder today but with outbreaks of rain .
some brighter spells later .
highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
charlie has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: water supply work to start this month
text: severn trent has announced plans to improve the water supply in shrewsbury .
work to replace pipes could mean some disruption in the porthill area during half-term .
the company is holding a mobile drop-in session by the junction of new street and copthorne road between 15:00 and 18:00 today .
work is scheduled to begin on saturday , 18 february and should take around 10 days .

documents.title: weather warning for wind issued
text: the met office is warning about wet and windy weather on friday which could affect travel and produce some minor damage .
a weather warning is in place from 06:00 tomorrow until 23:55 .
yellow warning of wind for west midlands
make it stoke event kicks off .
two seddon schemes mentioned already
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: fears over future of cancer service at shropshire hospitals
text: radiotherapy services at shropshire 's hospitals could be downgraded - because health chiefs have not included the population of mid wales in their calculations .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: penny floor gets the thumbs up from snoop dogg
text: it seems matt giles ' penny kitchen floor is getting some high-profile admiration .
earlier , american rapper snoop dogg shared his appreciation for all the hard work .
new level of madness when @ twitterid posts my # pennyfloor video to his @ twitterid fans page

documents.title: weather watchers : damp and dull across the county
text: it might be feeling a bit milder , but there 's plenty of rain about today .
here 's how it 's looking in norton ( top ) and the view from kinnersley ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: is birmingham going to tax diesel cars ?
text: is birmingham going to tax diesel cars ?
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: latest : online grooming warning ; chicken breed concern ; floor made of pennies
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at :
- shropshire mum says giving her 11-year-old daughter a tablet device was a big mistake after she was groomed online
- poultry expert warning that some pure breed chickens could die out because of avian flu precautions
- telford family use 27,000 pennies to make a new kitchen floor
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wildlife trust sees improvement in river morda water quality
text: it 's thought the recent chemical pollution of a shropshire river is n't as bad as first feared .
the environment agency is still investigating the spillage into the river morda near oswestry , which killed fish and clouded the water .
there 's also a wider concern about the river 's spawning grounds .

documents.title: warning to parents over online grooming
text: a shropshire mum is warning of the dangers of children having their own phones and other devices after her daughter was groomed online .
the 11-year-old was targeted by strangers on chat room websites .
the mother , who is n't being named to protect her identity , says giving her daughter a tablet device was a big mistake .
as far as my daughter was concerned he was n't a stranger .
the hardest moment was realising that our beautiful , clever daughter had now been sexualised in a disgusting way . ''

documents.title: 'it is not acceptable ' - shropshire firefighters attacked dozens of times on duty
text: firefighters in shropshire have been attacked dozens of times while on duty in the past four years , new figures show .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: pictures : kitchen floor made of pennies
text: a shropshire man 's kitchen floor is now made entirely out of 1p coins .
matt giles , from the rock in telford , stuck 27,000 of the coppers down individually .
he says the shiny new look was worth all the pain .

documents.title: weather : wet and windy
text: a blustery and damp start to the day with showers continuing throughout the day .
it could turn brighter later this afternoon but staying mild - highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: ice hockey : mid-week win for tigers
text: telford tigers extended their lead at the top of the english premier league with a 6-3 win over hull pirates last night .
victory means they 're now 11 points clear at the top of the standings .
it was a massive two points on the road for us tonight .
we were a bit slow out of the blocks in the first period , but overall i 'm really pleased with how we played . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest : 11-year-old targeted in chat rooms ; river concern ; kitchen floor covered in pennies
text: our top stories this morning :
- shropshire mum warns of online grooming after her daughter is targeted
- concern over spawning grounds in river morda after chemical pollution
- shropshire man 's kitchen floor made entirely out of 1p coins
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest from bbc shropshire
text: good morning , i 'm in the bbc shropshire newsroom taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you have something to share you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : some rain this evening and overnight
text: it 's been mostly dry today , but we 're forecast some showers this evening and overnight .
temperatures will be relatively mild - up to 10c ( 50c ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: on midlands today : university 's gaming degree in demand
text: this evening on midlands today we hear how students are queuing up to get on to a gaming degree .
it comes as , last year , more than 30 million people in the uk played video games , and sales reached a record high .
i 'll find out what that means for the next generation of designers and programmers , on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: Laura Mcmullan
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : telford sign fleetwood goalkeeper on loan
text: afc telford united have moved to replace james montgomery by signing matt urwin on loan from league one fleetwood town .
the 23-year-old is yet to make an appearance in the football league , but has appeared for afc fylde in the national league north .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: river severn the focus for wildlife trust open evening
text: the shropshire wildlife trust is holding an open evening in bridgnorth tonight to discuss all aspects of the river severn .
and this is the figurehead for one of the boats owned by the wildlife trust boat , de sabrina , the goddess of the severn - it will be one of the talking points tonight .
the open evening starts at 19:00 at the town 's bassa villa pub .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: oswestry climber wins selfie competition
text: an oswestry climber has won a national selfie-taking competition .
steve darrall took this while on the summit of glyder fach in snowdonia .
the competition was run by the national accident helpline and attracted over 400 entries .
it was run during accident awareness week to get people thinking about their safety while they are taking selfies .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: flood alerts issued in shropshire
text: the environment agency has issued two flood alerts for shropshire , covering the river worfe near cosford and the river corve between ludlow and onibury .
levels on the corve have already peaked and the worfe is expected to peak overnight .

documents.title: headlines : call for hope valley speed limit ; over 200 volunteer for diy sos show ; climber wins selfie competition
text: our headlines this evening :
- call for 40mph speed limit on part of main road through hope valley
- more than 200 turn out to volunteer for diy sos programme in telford
- oswestry climber wins selfie competition
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : sunshine appearing from behind the cloud in shropshire
text: in recent weeks we 've seen very little of the sun , with clouds covering the skies , so it 's been a nice change to get some photos from the bbc weather watchers showing blue sky .
these were taken near whitchurch ( top ) and oakengates ( below ) earlier this afternoon .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: more than 200 turn out to offer help to diy sos show
text: more than 200 tradespeople turned out to meet the bbc 's diy sos team earlier today , to hear how they could help with a project in telford later in the month .
they 'll be asked to adapt the home of matthew cooper from trench who suffered two strokes and paralysis while undergoing treatment for a brain tumour .
the work will involve building a downstairs extension with space for a carer to stay , along with a wet room and physio space .
matthew will also need the ground floor of his home adapting , so he can get around it easily , before he can return home .

documents.title: three-legged platinum fox tracked down
text: three-legged platinum fox tracked down

documents.title: shropshire hospital chiefs reveal details of their vision for the first time
text: the trust that controls shropshire 's two main hospitals has - for the first time - released a detailed breakdown about which services would be based at each of the county 's two acute hospitals should the future fit board 's favoured option be approved .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: tunisian arrested in anti-terrorism raids
text: a tunisian man has been arrested in frankfurt , suspected of recruiting for islamic state , and being involved in two attacks in tunis , which killed dozens of tourists - including retired solicitor sally adey , from caynton near albrighton .
the 36-year-old was taken into custody during a series of anti-terrorism raids involving more than 1,000 officers .
he was one of 16 people arrested across the central state of hesse , as 1,100 police searched flats , businesses and mosques .
twenty-one tourists and a tunisian were killed in march 2015 .

documents.title: cash from comic relief benefits vulnerable men
text: a £ 4,000 grant from comic relief is being used to support a walking football project in whitchurch , which benefits men mainly over 55 .
playing once a week helps keep the men fit and forge friendships at the same time .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : diy sos team visit telford
text: the bbc 's diy sos team has been in telford today , to recruit local tradespeople for a project later this month .
they 've been asked to make alterations to the home of matthew cooper from trench who has been battling a brain tumour .
mark millar from the programme team got to talk to matthew 's old headmistress julie henry .

documents.title: headlines : changes to lawley lights considered ; call for speed limit reduction ; diy sos team visits
text: here 's a recap of our headline this afternoon :
- changes to lawley traffic lights considered after crash
- hope valley residents call for 40mph speed limit
- diy sos team recruits local tradespeople for project in telford
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: transformation of fire-ravaged mill at alveley nears completion
text: it is rising from the ashes - and now the finishing touches are being put to the historic mill at alveley , near bridgnorth .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your comments : relief after escaped fox is recovered
text: thor the three-legged fox from hoo farm animal kingdom has become a popular little animal since escaping his enclosure at hoo farm animal kingdom .
and the news that he had been recovered this morning after four nights on the run has been welcomed by people visiting bbc radio shropshire 's facebook page .
kim byers wrote : `` glad to hear they have him back safely . ''
there was also relief when he was first located yesterday .
lucy emma hinds wrote : `` phew , been thinking about him . ''
and zoe marple added : `` excellent news ! !
thanks goodness ! ! !
bet thor is glad to back all , safe and sound ! ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers travel to hull to take on pirates
text: telford tigers are on the road to hull tonight , to take on the pirates .
they have a nine-point lead at the top of the epl table , although second-placed milton keynes lightning could reduce that with their two games in hand .
the pirates have already beaten them 6-0 on humberside this season .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: whitchurch herald front page : hotel rated one of the best in the uk
text: a whitchurch hotel is celebrating after being rated one of the best in the uk by a major online booking site .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: changes to lawley traffic lights considered after crash
text: changes could be made to the traffic lights in lawley , following a series of road accidents around the newdale cross junction .

telford and wrekin council says it is talking to the police to understand the cause of the latest one , earlier this week , which resulted in a woman having to be cut free from the wreckage of her car .

the authority said it has taken steps to improve the coordination of the lights , but it is carrying out a review to see if they can be improved further and if improvements to the signage and road-markings could help .

documents.title: your photos : rivers in shrewsbury and ludlow
text: the weather has cleared up a bit today and it seems to have inspired the bbc weather watchers to get out and take photos of rivers around the county .
here we have the english bridge in shrewsbury ( top ) and dinham bridge in ludlow ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: shrewsbury hospital ivf centre 'not fit for purpose '
text: the fertility department at the royal shrewsbury hospital could be moved after being described as and `` posing a significant risk '' to the health and safety of patients .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : morda water quality improves ; traffic light changes discussed ; call for lower speed limits
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- water quality on river morda improving after pollution leak
- changes to lawley traffic lights considered after crash
- hope valley residents want lower speed limit
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : hope valley residents 'taking their lives in their hands '
text: people living in the hope valley are being asked if they would like the speed limit along their stretch of the a488 reduced from 60mph to 50mph , but some think it should be reduced even further .
shropshire councillor heather kidd says people are `` overwhelmingly '' telling her they want a 40mph limit and she is planning to meet highways engineers to make that point .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: weather : light cloud and some sunshine this afternoon
text: we 're forecast light cloud and some sunshine this afternoon , with light winds .
it could rain again overnight .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: weather : gale warning for friday
text: people in our area are being warned there could be gale-force winds on friday .
the met office has issued a yellow weather warning from 06:00 on the day , saying there could be gusts of around 50-60mph .
yellow warning of wind for west midlands

documents.title: man airlifted to hospital after two-car crash near llanfyllin
text: a man has been airlifted to hospital after a two-vehicle road traffic collision near llanfyllin on wednesday morning .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: trades people to meet diy sos team ahead of team build in telford
text: trades people from across shropshire will meet the diy sos team ahead of the show 's latest build in telford .
the bbc tv programme is going to remodel 12-year-old matthew cooper 's house in trench .
matthew spent over a year in hospital fighting a brain tumour and without the work he ca n't go back to his family home .
today those who 've volunteered to help , will be briefed by the build team , ahead of work starting at the end of the month .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: telford and wrekin council to set up price comparison website
text: telford and wrekin council is looking to set up a council-branded energy price comparison website .
the idea is to help those affected by fuel poverty and make a bit of extra cash for the labour-controlled authority .
it 'll cost £ 3,000 to set up but its earning potential for the council depends on how successful it is .
it will get money for every switch made , but needs 249 in the first year alone to break even .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury make 11th hour loan signing
text: shrewsbury town have been busy during the january transfer window and managed to sneak in one more , just before it closed .
they signed 19-year-old midfielder ryan yates on loan from nottingham forest - their eighth signing of the month .

the central midfielder spent the first half of the season on loan at barrow where he made 19 appearances scoring two goals and shrewsbury manager paul hurst believes he will add depth to his midfield .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: telford brothers caught dealing heroin and cocaine from car
text: police caught two telford brothers dealing drugs from a car in the town , a court heard .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : fertility centre move possible ; mp train overcrowding concern ; escaped fox recaptured
text: our headlines this morning :
- shrewsbury fertility centre could move to new premises
- mp raises concerns about train overcrowding
- escaped three-legged fox is recaptured
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: breakingescaped fox recaptured
text: thor , the three-legged fox that escaped from hoo farm animal kingdom at the weekend , has been recaptured .
he was tracked down to a wood yesterday and last night he was caught in a trap left out for him .
the wildlife centre says he `` seems very relieved to be back home '' .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: thousands at risk of heart disease
text: an estimated 620,000 people in the uk have a faulty gene that puts them at risk of developing coronary heart disease or sudden death , and most are unaware , a charity has warned .
former shropshire batsman james taylor was one of them .
he was forced to retire at the age of 26 , in april last year after being diagnosed with arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy .
however , unlike taylor , the british heart foundation said many people could be unaware of having the faulty gene to blame for many of the conditions .
the charity says more research is urgently needed .
author: BBC News Health

documents.title: diversion as roadworks to shut a442 between telford and bridgnorth for three weeks
text: the main route between telford and bridgnorth is to be be closed throughout the day for almost three weeks for resurfacing - with drivers facing a 13-mile diversion .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: fertility centre could move out of royal shrewsbury hospital
text: shropshire 's fertility treatment centre could be moved out of the royal shrewsbury hospital to more modern premises .
the suggestion to the board that runs the hospital is that it should move to the severn fields medical practice in shrewsbury .
it would cost £ 180,000 each year to rent space from the private company which owns the building .
but a report to board directors says leaving it where it is would cost more upfront to upgrade buildings that are out of date .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: overcrowding on trains has become 'intolerable '
text: shrewsbury and atcham mp daniel kawczynski says the level of overcrowding on trains between shrewsbury and birmingham has become `` intolerable '' .
he was speaking in the house of commons and asked transport minister chris grayling to look at the `` levels of overcrowding '' on the welsh train network - arriva .
mr grayling said there were n't enough diesel trains to go around .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest : fertility centre set to move out of royal shrewsbury hospital ; new loan deal for shrewsbury town
text: the top stories in shropshire :
- mp says overcrowding is intolerable on trains between shrewsbury and birmingham
fertility centre set to move out of royal shrewsbury hospital to more modern premises
- new loan deal for shrewsbury town as they sign ryan yates
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: a wet start for many , with rain gradually clearing away .
drier and brighter by the afternoon , with sunny spells and the odd shower .
feeling mild , especially in any sunshine .
top temperatures of 10c ( 50f )
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : accident causes delays on the a5 southbound
text: there 's slow traffic on the a5 southbound this morning at ruyton-xi-towns at the b4396 junction , because of an accident .
for more information visit the bbc travel page .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather updates this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or you 'd like to share with the rest of the county .
you can email , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury sign forest midfielder yates
text: shrewsbury sign forest midfielder yates

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: over 9,000 in shropshire sign trump ban petition
text: a petition calling for donald trump 's state visit to the uk to be cancelled has now been signed by more than 1.6m people , including over 9,153 in shropshire .
it is due to be debated by mps on 20 february .
last night between 30 and 40 people turned out in wellington to voice opposition to the president 's immigration ban .

documents.title: weather : more rain forecast overnight
text: we 're forecast more rain overnight , some of it heavy , but it should clear up by the morning .
lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: shropshire school looking into becoming a multi-academy trust
text: a shropshire school is looking at the option of forming a multi-academy trust .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers look to extend lead at top of table
text: telford tigers travel to hull pirates tomorrow , looking to extend their nine point lead at the top of the epl table .
their opponents beat them 6-0 earlier in the season and head coach tom watkins has promised his team will be fully prepared for the game .

watkins has also praised the contribution of netminders sam gospel and jon baston , who have shared keeping duties since baston 's arrival , conceding only eight goals between them over the past four games .
with jon arriving , it has actually made sam gospel a better goaltender , and both are putting in some fine performances together .
they 've made some key saves at key times and both are game-changers . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest : mp gives brexit warning ; police recover imitation firearms and stun guns ; escaped fox located
text: our headlines this evening :
- mp warns of `` catastrophic damage '' to reputation of parliament if brexit is prevented
- over 180 imitation firearms and stun guns recovered by police
- escaped three-legged fox is located
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: north shropshire mp urges doubters to back brexit bill
text: the north shropshire mp , owen paterson , has spoken in a parliamentary debate on brexit , urging his fellow mps to vote in favour of triggering article 50 .

scottish nationalists and the liberal democrats will oppose the measure , along with some labour mps , but mr paterson said it could cause `` catastrophic damage '' to the reputation of parliament , the media and the judiciary , if britain does n't honour the result of the eu referendum .
a vote on the bill is set to take place tomorrow .

just think of the chattering , catastrophic damage to the integrity of the political establishment , i would say the media establishment and following the judgement last week , the judical establishment , if this is not delivered . ''

documents.title: over 180 imitation firearms and stun guns recovered by police
text: west mercia police say 165 imitation firearms and 16 stun guns have either been seized or handed in over the last three years .
the force has also revealed it made 26 arrests for offences involving imitation guns and 24 arrests for those involving stun guns , between january 2014 and december 2016 .

over the same period , 3,786 firearms were either handed in to the police in west mercia or seized by officers , with roughly three quarters of them recovered in herefordshire and worcestershire , the rest in shropshire .

documents.title: watch : missing three-legged fox is located
text: it might take a few days to recapture him , but thor the escaped three-legged fox has been located after three days on the run .
( pictures by tracy elliott )
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : grey cloud and mist around the county
text: it 's been another grey and misty day and that 's reflected in the photos being shared by the bbc weather watchers .
these were taken near oakengates ( top ) and ludlow ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: deadline day : speculation on more football transfers
text: there are just a few hours to go before the january transfer window closes and these are the thoughts of bbc radio shropshire 's sports editor , james bond .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest : supermarket plans could go ahead ; missing fox found ; warning of high winds
text: our headlines this afternoon :
- ludlow supermarket plans could be set for approval
- missing three-legged fox located
- warning of 60-70pmh winds on friday
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: wildlife volunteers to chat to lonely people in shropshire
text: wildlife trust volunteers will be visiting the homes of lonely people in shropshire , to put up bird feeders and have a chat about wildlife while they are there .
it 's an initiative being run jointly with the shropshire clinical commissioning group , which says there are a growing number of people who are `` socially isolated , or at risk of becoming so '' .
the project is being supported by the big lottery fund and the volunteers will be getting training before visiting people 's homes .
watching birds can bring a lot of joy and sharing the experience helps build friendship between people . ''

documents.title: almost 400 firearms seized by shropshire police in one year
text: nearly 400 firearms were seized by police in shropshire last year , new figures have revealed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: warning of high winds later in the week
text: there 's a warning of high winds across shropshire , staffordshire , herefordshire and worcestershire on friday .
the met office says there could be gusts of 60 to 70 mph in places .
it warns of possible damage to trees , power lines and buildings and delays on the roads .

documents.title: deadline day : shrewsbury midfielder leaves and keeper could sign
text: shrewsbury town 's ian black has left the club .
the midfielder has been absent for the past month for personal reasons , and his contract has been cancelled by mutual consent .
meanwhile shrewsbury could be bringing in grimsby 's long-serving goalkeeper james mckeown before tonight 's transfer deadline .
mckeown recently handed in a transfer request there .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: diy sos comes to telford tomorrow
text: the bbc 's diy sos is recruiting trades people in telford tomorrow .
the show is preparing to help adapt the home of 11-year-old matthew cooper , from trench , who has been fighting cancer .
work is due to start at the end of february .
@ diysos needs our lovely , caring telford businesses
you wont go wrong with one of our # buckfastleigh lads !

documents.title: oswestry advertizer front page : medical centre car park
text: medical centre staff in oswestry have said they are not allowed to use a near-empty car park - even though it was built specifically for them .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: ludlow supermarket plans could be approved
text: a new supermarket at rocks green on the edge of ludlow could get the go-ahead after the applicants reduced the size of the planned store .
shropshire councillors had previously deferred a decision on the scheme , saying that they were `` minded to refuse '' .
a report due to go before them next week advises them to approve the new application .
ludlow 's independent shops are afraid the supermarket will take away their business .

documents.title: latest : ludlow supermarket set for approval ; three-legged fox found ; award for young farmer
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- councillors advised to approve ludlow supermarket plans
- escaped three-legged fox found alive in woodland
- young farmer wins award
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: missing three-legged fox is located
text: a three-legged white fox which escaped from a wildlife centre near telford on saturday has been located in nearby woods and farmland .
thor was believed to have jumped about 8ft ( 2.5m ) on to a branch which had fallen on to his enclosure fence at hoo farm animal kingdom .
centre co-owner edward dorrell said he was very relived '' , particularly as there had been few sightings of the four-year-old fox since his escape on saturday evening .
staff have been able to hand-feed the arctic-siberian fox cross but have not yet caught him .
author: Clare Lissaman
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : comic relief launches with details of last year 's beneficiaries
text: this year 's comic relief campaign has been officially launched this morning , with details of how you can sign up and take part .
the appeal has also been giving out details of the people who benefited from money raised last year .
they include the citizens advice bureau in wellington , which was given £ 200,000 and helped people like simon buckley-robins .

documents.title: weather : showers this afternoon and heavy rain this evening
text: we 're forecast more showers this afternoon and the rain could get heavy this evening - highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: trump protestors turn out in wellington
text: around 30 or 40 demonstrators turned out in wellington last night , to take part in protests against the immigration ban introduced by president trump .
thousands of people joined in similar demonstrations around the country and there have been calls for the president 's state visit to the uk to be cancelled .

documents.title: weather watchers : rainy shropshire
text: it 's pretty miserable out there , rain showers are forecast throughout the day , but that has n't stopped our weather watchers .
here 's how it 's looking in newport ( top ) and shrewsbury ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: police appeal after man attacked
text: a man has been attacked in an indian restaurant in wellington , police say .
the 54-year-old was punched in the head while sitting in the eastern balti on walker street on friday night .
police say there were a number of diners in the restaurant at the time and would like them to get in touch .

documents.title: trust counts £ 250,000 cost of recruiting consultant
text: the shrewsbury and telford hospitals trust have had to pay £ 250,000 for just one consultant .
the cost , which includes agency fees , is three times more than the national starting salary of £ 76,000 .
the trust admits the cost of this recruitment is high but says they 're struggling to recruit .
we are critically short of doctors in some areas and at the moment the way our services are laid out does n't support all our patient care . ''

documents.title: headlines : huge hospital bill for one consultant ; man attacked in restaurant ; rocks green supermarket plans
text: our top stories this morning :
- hospital pays £ 250,000 for one consultant and bosses admit they 're struggling to recruit doctors
- police appeal after man attacked in an indian restaurant in wellington
- shropshire councillors recommended to approve a new supermarket on the edge of ludlow
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: young farmer wins top award
text: a young shropshire farmer has won a prestigious national award .
andrew patterson , ( below ) from newport , has been milking cows since the age of 10 .
the 24-year-old has been awarded the president 's medal by the breeding company , holstein .

documents.title: football : payne has come to score goals for shrewsbury
text: shrewsbury town 's latest signing is confident he can prove himself at the club .
striker stefan payne has joined on loan from championship side barnsley until the end of the season .
the 25-year-old has only played a handful of games for barnsley , but they signed him after he scored 40 goals in 90 games for national league side dover athletic .
this chance to come to league one and score goals , think i can do it . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: almost 400 firearms seized by shropshire police in one year
text: nearly 400 firearms were seized by police in shropshire last year , new figures have revealed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: white fox still missing
text: thor - the three-legged white fox - still has n't been found .
he 's been spotted a number of times since he went missing from hoo farm animal kingdom , near telford , on saturday .
the four-year-old arctic-silver fox cross has most recently been spotted near howle , newport .
farm co-owner , edward dorrell , said the fox got out after a small branch fell on to his enclosure fence .

documents.title: latest : £ 250k consultant bill ; top award for farmer ; white fox still missing
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- hospital pays £ 250,000 for a consultant as it struggles to recruit
- young shropshire farmer wins prestigious national award
- the search continues for a white fox that 's escaped from a farm-zoo near telford
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a grey and murky day
text: a damp start to the morning with heavy rain later - highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
sara has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm in the newsroom taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you have a story or to share , you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : showers across shropshire tonight
text: there will be some light showers across shropshire overnight and some fog returning in the morning .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: man treated after being trapped in crowded lift
text: a town clerk had to be treated by paramedics after he was stuck in a crowded lift for almost an hour with temperatures reaching 100f .
author: Oswestry and Borders Chronicle

documents.title: four dogs shot for worrying livestock last year
text: four dogs were shot for attacking or killing farm animals in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire last year , west mercia police says .
the force recorded 11 reports of livestock being chased in 2016 , 40 incidents of dogs killing farm animals and 11 other attacks .

documents.title: sandwiches back on menu at hospitals
text: sandwiches back on menu at hospitals

documents.title: football : market drayton sign winger to contract
text: market drayton town have taken the unusual step of signing one of their players to a contract .

the club , who play in the evo-stik npl division one south , have been inspired by cohen bramall 's move from hednesford to arsenal and say they need `` to protect the club 's interests when big name teams come knocking on the door to take our best players '' .
bramall played for market drayton early in his career and the club say they want to build on their `` reputation as a club that builds young talent '' .
they believe winger 19-year-old shaquille whittingham is `` one to watch for the future '' .
there is a huge financial commitment to contracting players at this level but there is a contract for everyone at the club who can really show us their potential week in week out . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: three sightings of missing fox
text: there have been three sightings of the missing three-legged fox thor , since it went missing from hoo farm animal kingdom , near telford , on saturday .

the co-owner of the attraction , edward dorrell , said he was surprised there have n't been more reports of the four-year-old arctic-silver fox cross , which lost one of its legs after injuring itself in its enclosure when it was young .
mr dorrell said thor was a `` real softie '' and used to people but he was concerned the fox was not used to traffic .

documents.title: headlines : hospitals agree sandwich deal ; increase in speed-related crashes ; shrewsbury sign striker
text: our headlines this evening :
- hospitals find new sandwich supplier after disagreement over payments
- increase in speed-related traffic collisions reported by police
- shrewsbury town sign barnsley striker on loan
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury sign barnsley striker payne
text: shrewsbury sign barnsley striker payne

documents.title: football : barnsley striker joins shrewsbury town on loan
text: shrewsbury town have signed barnsley striker stefan payne on loan until the end of the season .
the 25-year-old former fulham trainee has had spells at eight different clubs and was prolific in the lower leagues , scoring 40 goals in 85 appearances for dover athletic .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: hospitals find new sandwich supplier
text: sandwiches are going back on the menu at the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford , because another company has been found to supply them .
the last contractor pulled out after the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust asked them to renegotiate their deal and accept a new payment schedule .
the hospital trust says it apologises for the inconvenience to patients over the past three weeks .

documents.title: fears for missing three-legged white fox
text: fears for missing three-legged white fox

documents.title: increase in speed-related collisions
text: last year there were 147 traffic collisions in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire which the police say were at least partially caused by speeding .
seven of those collisions were fatal - that 's 16 more collisions than in 2015 and the highest number for five years .
the force has also revealed the highest speed recorded in the region last year was 154mph ( 248kmph ) .

documents.title: football : tns sign romanian defender
text: the new saints of oswestry are set to sign a romanian defender .
mihai leca has also been a regular in the romanian under 21s side and joins from otelul galati in the romanian league .
leca has been training with the new saints for the past few days and international clearance is expected on wednesday .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : support for trump ban ; wrekin mp hospital concern ; three-legged fox escapes
text: our headlines this afternoon :
- more than 6,000 people in shropshire sign a petition calling for president trump 's state visit to be cancelled
- wrekin mp raises questions about hospital leadership after emergency care centre recommendation
- three-legged fox escapes from wildlife centre after a tree knocks down a fence
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : departing telford keeper thanks fans
text: james montgomery has left afc telford united on good terms and says he `` ca n't thank the fans enough '' for their support in his two years at the club .
afc telford united have responded by thanking the 22-year-old for his service .
montgomery admitted his dream was to eventually play at a higher level and the draw of full-time football was too strong to resist .
i 'm still young so development is still massive .
most keepers do n't come into their own until they are 30-year-olds , so i 'm still a young buck really .
so still got plenty of time and just want to keep on playing and keep on progressing . ''
everyone at afc telford united would like to thank @ twitterid for all the time and effort he spent at the club .
good luck monty !
this epitomizes why @ twitterid will be missed # topfella
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: no jail for soldier who helped organise brawl after telford match
text: a football thug who helped to incite a mass brawl after a match in shropshire has been spared jail .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: watch : telford man warms up for 'bum on seats ' challenge
text: in april , ian bamber , from telford , will be attempting to sit in every seat in preston north end 's stadium .
and this morning he 's been getting in some practice at afc telford united 's bucks head ground .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: more than 6,000 sign trump petition in shropshire
text: a petition calling for president trump to be banned from making a state visit to the uk has been signed by 6,261 people in shropshire - just over 1 % of the population .

it has been signed by more than a million people across the country and numbers of signatories have been rising rapidly since a us clampdown on immigration came into effect over the weekend , causing anger worldwide .
protests in response to mr trump 's executive order are expected to take place after 17:00 in a number of towns and cities around britain , including wellington in shropshire .

documents.title: weather : mist over the mere at ellesmere
text: we 've had more mist and cloud to start the day and the bbc weather watchers have been sharing some stunning photos , like this one taken in ellesmere .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: three-legged white fox escapes from wildlife centre
text: a three-legged white fox has escaped from a wildlife centre near telford , shropshire , after a tree fell and damaged one of the fences in its enclosure .
thor ( was last spotted in the crudgington area and hoo farm animal kingdom is asking people to get in touch if they see him .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : telford keeper signs for gateshead
text: james montgomery has left afc telford united to join gateshead .
the goalkeeper has moved back to his native north east for an undisclosed fee .
the 22-year-old says he 's loved his two years at telford , but was drawn by the promise of full-time football .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : wrekin mp hospital concerns ; over 6,00 sign trump petition ; telford keeper leaves
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- the wrekin mp raises concerns about hospital leadership after emergency care statement
- more than 6,000 in shropshire sign petition calling for president trump to be denied a state visit to the uk
- telford goalkeeper signs for gateshead
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: mp raises questions about hospital leadership
text: the mp for the wrekin has raised concerns about the people running the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford , after they came out in favour of having just one emergency care in the county , based in shrewsbury .
mark pritchard claimed the plans , which would also involve moving women and children 's services from telford to shrewsbury , would put lives at risk .
a review of hospital services , which made the same recommendations , is currently on hold after the county 's health commissioners called for independent scrutiny of the process so far .
a lot of people are calling into question the leadership of the hospital trust and the leadership of clinical commissioning group .
we 've had enough of this to-ing and fro-ing , indecision , ill-founded decision and potentially , this going to put lives at risk , if it goes ahead

documents.title: weather : dry and cloudy with some rain overnight
text: it 's going to stay dry and overcast this afternoon , but we are forecast some rain overnight .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: football : hurst pleased with pressure created by team
text: shrewsbury have climbed to 19th in league one after their away draw with gillingham and manager paul hurst is pleased with the pressure his side created in the second half .
he said the players were more physical and `` on the front foot '' after half time .
hurst also praised new signing alex rodman , who scored his first goal for the club since being released by notts county earlier this month .

documents.title: work starts on prees water pipes
text: work to replace a water pipe in prees , which has burst several times in recent years , is starting .
severn trent is spending £ 150,000 to to replace a 1,600ft ( 500m ) section of the 12-inch ( 30cm ) pipe and said a section of moreton street ( below ) would need to be closed to through traffic .
the job should take about a month to complete , severn trent said .

documents.title: man sitting in every seat of football stand
text: a telford man is going to be sitting on every single seat in the main stand at the bucks head this morning .
ian bamber is using it as a practice run for sitting on each of the 22,000 seats at preston north end 's deepdale stadium - his home town club .
he 'll be raising money for macmillan cancer support , after his sister was diagnosed with incurable cervical cancer and his mother had to have a mastectomy .

documents.title: headlines : rail delays ; ludlow tax rise considered ; chicken farm concern
text: our headlines this morning :
- trains delayed north of shrewsbury after man struck by level crossing
- ludlow town council considers putting up its precept by 25 %
- chicken farm plans concern roden residents
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: drug dealer locked up after heroin and cocaine bags found covered in fingerprints
text: a teenager has been jailed for three years after police found bags of class a drugs covered in his fingerprints when they raided a house .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: sport : telford tigers tighten grip on premier league
text: telford tigers tightened their grip on the english premier league title race with a 6-2 win over bracknell bees last night .
tigers are now nine points clear of second-placed milton keynes , but they have two games in hand in order to catch up .
tigers took the lead after just seven minutes , thanks to jason silverthorn , although they were pegged back by a bracknell goal just moments later .
the final session saw some clashing of handbags as both adam jones and doug clarkson were involved in fights with bees defenceman josh tetlow .
jonathan weaver and sam zajac rounded off the scoring for telford , alongside a consolation goal from bracknell .
the tigers are back in action on wednesday night when they travel north to face hull pirates .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: video : emergency services at scene after man struck by train
text: this was the scene earlier after a man was struck by a train in shrewsbury .
warning : this video contains flashing images
in the incident , at the harlescott level crossing , the man suffered severe head and pelvic injuries .
ambulance staff treated him and he was taken to hospital in stoke .
trains were delayed for some time as investigations got under way .
author: BBC Shropshire

documents.title: concern at plans for large-scale chicken farm
text: plans for a large-scale chicken farm in roden are causing some concern .
a local farmer wants to diversify and build four chicken sheds , with 65,000 birds in each .
a number of residents are concerned as it 's one of several chicken farm planning applications within a four-mile radius .
they 're also worried about the possibility of bad smells , lorries and pollution .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ludlow council tax could go up
text: ludlow town council will discuss a plan to put its share of council tax up by almost a quarter .
that does n't mean the entire bill rises by a quarter - it 's the town council 's share .
for the council tax year 2016/17 , its charge was just over £ 100 for a band d property .
in rural areas around ludlow it was considerably less - as little as £ 2 in boraston .

documents.title: weather : cool with cloudy skies
text: it will feel cool under cloudy skies , although some bright spells are possible later .
here 's sara blizzard with your forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: rail services delayed after person hit by train
text: trains travelling north in shropshire towards whitchurch are delayed for up to an hour after a person was struck at harlescott level crossing , in shrewsbury .
delays are expected on the line towards crewe until about 09:00 .
there is no news yet of the person involved .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : rail services delayed after person hit by train : ludlow town tax could go up : concern over large scale chicken farm
text: - trains were delayed northbound from shrewsbury this morning after someone was hit by a train .
- ludlow town council is to discuss putting up its share of council tax by 25 % .
- residents in roden concerned about plans for chicken sheds to accommodate 260,000 birds .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : train delays between crewe and shrewsbury
text: there are delays of up to 60 minutes and some cancellations on arriva trains wales services between shrewsbury and crewe this morning .
service update : # yorton and # shrewsbury lines have now reopened .
disruption is expected until 08:15
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: me and the team will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire
